result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Corrinthiaus Hutcherson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy Corrinthiaus Hutcherson appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Jeremy Corrinthiaus Hutcherson.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 11-16-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Defendant Jeremy Corrinthiaus Hutcherson appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Jeremy Corrinthiaus Hutcherson.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 10-13-22 at 8:30 am  for final pretrial and 11-16-22 at 8;30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy Corrinthiaus Hutcherson in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Court vacated previously issued stayed bench warrant.  Case is adjourned to 9-1-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.
  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MCJ, JJH, and the other children that live in the household of MCJ.

Defendant Jeremy Corrinthiaus Hutcherson in court.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 10 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/13/22 @ 2p
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/19/2022@100p

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
